statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content:
P is a permutation of the integers from 1 to N(index starting from 1).
Here is the code of Bubble Sort in C++.

for(int i=1;i<=N;++i)
    for(int j=N,t;j>i;—j)
        if(P[j-1] > P[j])
            t=P[j],P[j]=P[j-1],P[j-1]=t;

After the sort, the array is in increasing order. ?? wants to know the absolute values of difference of rightmost place and leftmost place for every number it reached.

statement.title: Input
statement.content:
The first line of the input gives the number of test cases T; T test cases follow.
Each consists of one line with one integer N, followed by another line with a permutation of the integers from 1 to N, inclusive.

limits
T <= 20
1 <= N <= 100000
N is larger than 10000 in only one case.

statement.title: Output
statement.content: For each test case output “Case #x: y1 y2 … yN” (without quotes), where x is the test case number (starting from 1), and yi is the difference of rightmost place and leftmost place of number i.

statement.title: Sample Output
statement.content:
Case #1: 1 1 2
Case #2: 0 0 0


Hint
In first case, (3, 1, 2) -> (3, 1, 2) -> (1, 3, 2) -> (1, 2, 3)
the leftmost place and rightmost place of 1 is 1 and 2, 2 is 2 and 3, 3 is 1 and 3
In second case, the array has already in increasing order. So the answer of every number is 0.
